## Hypothese

> Die Originalabbildung führt zu einer starken Überschätzung des tatsächlichen Effekts

## Ihre Daten

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| fig-width: 6
#| fig-height: 4
library(tidyverse)
library(ggdist)
eval(parse("https://survey.ph-karlsruhe.de/test23/?act=49pV9Nj9Zr0sihSpoQNeMZTk&vQuality&rScript", encoding="UTF-8"))

data <- ds %>% 
  # Filter der Testdaten
 # filter(STARTED > ymd_hms("2025-06-17 08:00:00")) %>% 
  mutate(Bedingung = case_when(condition == "headline_overlap" ~ "Alternative 2",
                               condition == "headline_u3" ~ "Alternative 1",
                               T ~ "Original"),
         `Differenz OECD/GER (in h)` = abs(as.numeric(cohend))*2.5)

ggplot(data, aes(`Differenz OECD/GER (in h)`, Bedingung)) +
 # geom_boxplot(width = .3) +
  geom_jitter(height = .1) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = .2*2.5) +
  geom_curve(aes(x = .75, y = 1.5, xend = 0.5, yend = 1.5),
           arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.02, "npc")),
           curvature = -0.3,
           color = "#237326") +
  # Label
  annotate("text", x = .77, y = 1.5, 
           label = "Wahrer Wert", 
           color = "#237326",
           hjust = 0) +
  labs(title = "Ihre Einschätzungen", subtitle = "je Bedingung") +
  ylab("") +
  theme_minimal()

ggplot(data, aes(`Differenz OECD/GER (in h)`, Bedingung)) +
  #stat_pointinterval(color = "darkgrey") +
  geom_boxplot(width = .2) +
  geom_jitter(height = .1, alpha = .5) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = .2*2.5) +
  geom_curve(aes(x = .75, y = 1.5, xend = 0.5, yend = 1.5),
           arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.02, "npc")),
           curvature = -0.3,
           color = "#237326") +
  # Label
  annotate("text", x = .77, y = 1.5, 
           label = "Wahrer Wert", 
           color = "#237326",
           hjust = 0) +
  labs(title = "Ihre Einschätzungen", subtitle = "je Bedingung") +
  ylab("") +
  theme_minimal() +
  xlim(c(0,5))
```
